alert.note: Alert for Beaufort (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued September 28 at 5:09AM EDT until October 01 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Up to 2 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the Pamlico and Pungo Rivers and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. A Coastal Flood Watch means that conditions favorable for flooding are expected to develop. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements or warnings, and take action to protect property.
